How long can you keep cooked salmon in the fridge? Cooked salmon can be kept in the refrigerator in a covered dish for  up to 4 days. Uncooked salmon should only be kept in the fridge for  2 to 3 days before cooking. Edit.

2. Salmon can be kept fresh in your freezer for up to eight weeks. When you bring home your fresh salmon take it out of the packaging, rinse it off using cold water and pat it dry. Cut your salmon into the desired portions and store it in freezer wrap, foil, freezer bags or an airtight freezer friendly container.
